title: Misty conditions expected in several areas during the morning
byline: The Department of Meteorology says showers or thundershowers may occur at a few places in Galle, Matara, Kaluthara and Rathnapura districts in the evening or night.

title: ‘Meenagaya’ train hits and kills 5 elephants, derails at Gal Oya
byline: The Batticaloa-Colombo train, ‘Meenagaya’, has collided with a herd of elephants at Gal Oya, resulting in the tragic death of five elephants, Sri Lanka Railways said.

title: A$AP Rocky found not guilty of firearm assault on LA street
byline: Rapper A$AP Rocky has been found not guilty of firing a gun at a former friend.

title: Israel prepares to receive first dead hostages from Hamas
byline: Hamas is to transfer to Israel the bodies of four hostages who have been held in Gaza since being taken alive in the group’s attack on Israel on 7 October 2023.

title: Internal affairs units to be established in all govt institutions
byline: A decision has been made to establish an Internal Affairs Unit in all government institutions to ensure effective public services.

title: Trade union claims health sector staff allowances cut in 2025 Budget
byline: The Joint Council of Professions Supplementary to Medicine (JCPSM) alleges that the government has taken steps to cut the allowances of health sector employees through this year’s budget proposal.

title: Dasun Shanaka fined by SLC for contract breach?
byline: Former captain Dasun Shanaka has been fined USD 10,000 by Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) for breaching his contractual obligations after allegedly faking an injury to leave a first-class match in Sri Lanka in order to play for the Dubai Capitals in the UAE.

title: Veteran singer Amitha Wedisinghe passes away
byline: Veteran singer Amitha Wedisinghe has passed away this morning (20), family sources said.

title: Another suspect arrested in connection with “Ganemulla Sanjeewa” murder
byline: The driver of the van used by the gunman in the “Ganemulla Sanjeewa” shooting to flee towards Puttalam, has also been arrested by police.

title: Fitch Ratings optimistic on Sri Lanka’s Budget
byline: The Sri Lankan government’s budget highlights the authorities’ commitment to raising fiscal revenues as a share of GDP - an approach that, if successful, would alleviate a long-standing weakness in the sovereign’s credit profile, says Fitch Ratings.

title: Two more wanted Sri Lankan criminals repatriated from India
byline: Two other wanted Sri Lankan suspects, who were arrested in Chennai, India, along with the Police Constable (PC) who aided in the escape attempt of notorious drug trafficker Nadun Chinthaka Wickremeratne alias “Harak Kata” from Criminal Investigation Department (CID) ...

title: Police seek public assistance to arrest woman who aided court shooting, offers reward
byline: The Colombo Crimes Division (CCD) has requested public assistance to trace the suspected woman who provided the weapon to the gunman inside the Aluthkade Courts Complex for the shooting which killed the notorious organized criminal Sanjeewa Kumara Samararatne, alias “Ganemulla Sanjeewa”.

title: Aluthkade Court shooting not a threat to national security: Public Security Minister
byline: Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala says that the shooting incident that took place inside the Hulftsdrop (Aluthkade) Courts Complex on Wednesday (20) was not any sort of threat to the national security, but instead is linked to longstanding conflicts between organized criminal gangs.

title: No relatives come forward to claim body of ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’
byline: No relatives of Sanjeewa Kumara Samararatne, also known as “Ganemulla Sanjeewa”, who was killed in a shooting inside the Magistrate’s Court No. 05 at the Aluthkade Courts Complex on Wednesday (19), have come forward to claim his remains.

title: Several schoolchildren found in possession of live ammunition in Hasalaka
byline: A number of live ammunition rounds have been discovered in the possession of several young schoolchildren in the Hasalaka area on February 19.

title: Elephant death toll in ‘Meenagaya’ train accident climbs to 6
byline: The number of elephants killed after the Batticaloa-Colombo train, ‘Meenagaya’, collided with a herd of elephants at Gal Oya has risen to six, while another elephant is reportedly critically injured.

title: Trump says he is speaking to China about TikTok
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump told reporters on Air Force One on Wednesday that he was talking to China about TikTok as the United States seeks to broker a sale of the popular app.

title: Sri Lanka and India to jointly establish solar power plants in Trinco
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved the proposal presented by the Minister of Power and Energy to take further necessary steps related to the establishment of two solar power plants with capacity of 50 Megawatt and 70 Megawatt at Sampur in Trincomalee, as a joint venture between Sri Lanka and India.

title: Sri Lanka moves to introduce broad law for terrorism prevention
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to appoint a committee headed by President’s Counsel Rienzie Arsekularatne to present eligible resolutions to further develop amendments to amend the draft bill on prevention of terrorism.

title: Decision taken to search all including lawyers entering Appeals Court
byline: A decision has been made to conduct thorough inspections on all persons, including lawyers, entering the Appeals Court complex.

title: Suspects in ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’ murder to be detained under PTA
byline: The Colombo Crimes Division (CCD) has informed the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court that two suspects are currently in police custody in connection with the murder of “Ganemulla Sanjeewa” and that they will be detained under the Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA) for further investigations.
